methods.Step 1: Heat the oilUnsure of the quantity needed?Click on the underlined ingredient to reveal the quantity. No need to flip back and forth!OK, Got It (1 tbsp olive oil) in a large deep frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the chicken (4 chicken thigh cutlets, skin-on), skin-side down, and cook for 8 minutes or until golden. Turn the chicken. Add the potatoes (400g baby coliban (chat) potatoes, halved) to the pan and cook, turning potatoes, for 5 minutes.
methods.Step 2: Add the stock (375ml (1 1/2 cups) chicken stock) to the pan and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, covered, for 20-25 minutes or until chicken and potatoes are cooked through.
methods.Step 3: Meanwhile, combine butter (25g butter, at room temperature) and flour (1 tbsp plain flour) in a small bowl.
methods.Step 4: Remove chicken from the pan. Add lemon rind (1 tbsp finely grated lemon rind) and juice (80ml (1/3 cup) fresh lemon juice) to the pan and stir to combine. Add flour mixture to sauce and whisk until smooth and combined. Return chicken to pan and bring to the boil. Boil for 1 minute or until thickened.
methods.Step 5: Scatter over the basil (Small fresh basil leaves, to serve). Serve with green beans (Steamed green beans, to serve).
